message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NE, cs.GR, cs.AL. 

This paper deals with the problem of constructing sparse hopsets in a distributed setting, which is a fundamental problem in distributed computing and graph algorithms. The paper uses techniques from graph algorithms, distributed computing, and approximation algorithms. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), and cs.NE (Networks and Ethernet). Additionally, the paper deals with graph algorithms, so cs.GR (Computer Science and Game Theory) and cs.AL (Computational Complexity) are also likely sub-categories.
